danish_publication: Der var en dødning begravet östen for Klemmensgård i Bratten. Den dødning var vistnok meget hengiven til drik, for hvert år de bryggede juleöl i Klemmensgård, gik der al tid fald på det, enten gik bunden af karret eller tappen af tønden, eller båndene sprang, og öllet spildtes, og det fik dødningen skyld for. Men den er gravet op, og siden den tid har de intet öl mistet.
english_publication: Once there was a dead person buried east of Klemmensgård in Bratten. The dead one was apparently really predisposed to drink since every year when they brewed Christmas beer in Klemmensgård something always went wrong, either the bottom fell out of the tub or the tap came off the keg or the keg bands burst and the beer spilled and the dead person was blamed for that. But the corpse was dug up and they haven’t lost any beer since then.
